info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 12 at 4:22PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...north central Caldwell County, North Carolina * WHEN...Until 1015 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Nuisance flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to streams and other poor-drainage areas, including farmland, parks, greenways, boat-access areas, and campgrounds. Isolated, shallow flows over roadways is possible. A few flood-prone, low-water crossings may become impassible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 415 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the Advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen over the past 2-3 hours. Areas within the Buffalo Creek and Yadkin River watersheds north of Patterson are most vulnerable to rapid stream rises and nuisance to Minor flooding. This includes near Old Field Creek Ln, Old Sampson Rd, Buffalo Cove Rd, Richland Rd, and Stone Mountain Rd. Please avoid all low-water crossings as floodwaters will occur quickly. - Additional rainfall may result in more significant flooding. A Flash Flood Warning may be required. Please be prepared to seek higher ground if you live near a vulnerable, low-lying area adjacent to a stream. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Buffalo Creek, Richland, and Patterson. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
